text:
Hi Jon, 
so sorry for disappearing, for some reason the app just didn't let me know there are any new messages waiting!
Jup, my internship is in bachelors course in university. It's quite nice because sometimes it just feels like I'm getting paid to work!
I think I would prefer to work in film just because I watch films more often but I'd like to try both at some point so I could answer for sure!

As for a film that inspired me to get into vfx- not exactly! I went to bachelors for computer animation because I got inspired by a behind the scenes video of an animation film "Over the Hedge". I wanted to do little cute characters that felt like they're real. But when I got there I realised I didn't actually enjoy it. I still went through the course trying to find something I could imagine doing in the future but stylised just didn't do it for me. And then in 3rd year we had a few more projects more focused on realistic work and I really loved doing a dmp projection project. After that I completely changed my focus and went for a masters in Digital Effects

However, looking back it kinda makes sense because I really like mystical films and tv series like Divergent, vampire diaries, hunger games, mad max... so I'm hopping to one day do matte paintings for dystropian type movies
How about you, what films/events inspired you to get into VFX?
My teacher recommended to put in a the 'graduate showreel' title to kind of help with getting a junior role. Why, does it look weird to have that?

That's the thing with solo projects, I had to go through the whole pipeline to finish a project so I don't have a lot of dmp work only. But I would prefer to tailor it a bit more dmp in that case because I couldn't really want to go into comp if I can help it
That's why I was thinking that probably a small studio would be the way forward in the start
Do you enjoy working in Cinesite? :)
